TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {12807=Tax Notes is #1 by a wide margin in citations in law reviews (1165 v. #2's Virginia Tax Review's 554), but fairs relatively poorly (.001, ranked #24) in the Impact Factor category (citations/number of articles published).  My guess is that W&L counted as "articles" all of the advance sheet material in Tax Notes. All rights reserved., 86275=Friday, August 22, 2008, 49461=May 21, 2009 in Law Review Rankings, Legal Education | Permalink | Comments (1) | TrackBack (0), 91190=Friday, August 15, 2008, 24314=Thursday, January 27, 2011, 55161=May 14, 2009 in Law Review Rankings, Legal Education | Permalink | Comments (1) | TrackBack (0), 14126=July 27, 2011 in Law Review Rankings, Legal Education | Permalink | Comments (0) | TrackBack (0), 38111=February 17, 2010 in Law Review Rankings, Legal Education, Tax | Permalink | Comments (12) | TrackBack (0), 8684=In 2011, for the first time since the U.S. Postal Service began requiring law reviews to track and report their circulation numbers, no major law review had more than 2,000 paying subscribers. The Harvard Law Review remains the top journal, but its paid circulation has declined from more than 10,000 during much of the 1960s and ’70s to about 5,000 in the 1990s to 1,896 last year., 37434=Davies documents an enromous decline in law review circulation over the 1979-2009 period.  The Tax Law Review's circulation, for example, has declined 89.1% from a peak of 5,685 in 1980-81 to 620 in 2006-07., 100190=July 28, 2008 in Law Review Rankings | Permalink | Comments (2) | TrackBack (0), 76501=October 7, 2008 in Law Review Rankings | Permalink | Comments (0) | TrackBack (0), 65863=February 2, 2009 in Law Review Rankings, Legal Education | Permalink | Comments (2) | TrackBack (0), 34615=Wednesday, February 17, 2010, 10230=February 29, 2012 in Law Review Rankings, Legal Education | Permalink | Comments (1) | TrackBack (0), 115011=Wednesday, July 16, 2008, 46786=August 11, 2009 in Law Review Rankings, Legal Education | Permalink | Comments (1) | TrackBack (0), 89604=August 22, 2008 in Law Review Rankings | Permalink | Comments (21) | TrackBack (0), 84706=September 25, 2008 in Law Review Rankings | Permalink | Comments (9) | TrackBack (0), 101782=Thursday, July 24, 2008, 19715=July 21, 2011 in Law Review Rankings, Legal Education, Tax | Permalink | Comments (1) | TrackBack (0), 125737=Sunday, July 6, 2008, 30543=Monday, May 3, 2010, 151769=© Copyright 2004-2014 by Law Professor Blogs, LLC. All rights reserved., 42615=August 28, 2009 in Law Review Rankings, Legal Education, Scholarship | Permalink | Comments (1) | TrackBack (0), 14769=Thursday, July 21, 2011, 20410=Monday, February 14, 2011, 71805=October 16, 2008 in Law Review Rankings | Permalink | Comments (0) | TrackBack (0), 73375=Tuesday, October 7, 2008, 50130=Thursday, May 14, 2009, 41129=This brief Essay reports a study of citations to every article published in 1992 in thirteen leading law journals. It uses citations as a proxy (an admittedly poor one) of article quality and then compares the citations across journals. There are, not surprisingly, vast differences in the number of citations per article. While articles in the most elite journals receive more citations on average than the other less elite (but still highly regarded) journals studied, some articles in the less elite journals are more heavily cited than many articles in even the most elite journals. In keeping with studies in other disciplines and other citation studies of legal journals, the results here suggest that we should be wary of judgments about quality based on place of publication. We should also be wary of judgments about quality of scholarship based on the number of citations, and we should, therefore, continue to evaluate scholarship through close reads of it., 124145=July 7, 2008 in Law Review Rankings | Permalink | Comments (1) | TrackBack (0), 118674=July 16, 2008 in Law Review Rankings | Permalink | Comments (2) | TrackBack (0), 129983=July 6, 2008 in Law Review Rankings | Permalink | Comments (1) | TrackBack (0), 5933=November 19, 2012 in Law Review Rankings, Legal Education | Permalink | Comments (0) | TrackBack (0), 38826=Friday, August 28, 2009, 33971=May 3, 2010 in Law Review Rankings, Legal Education | Permalink | Comments (1) | TrackBack (0), 105621=The next U.S. News law school rankings aren't published until late March 2009, and we do not plan to make a decision on this issue until fall 2008 or early 2009. As we have done in the past before we change our methodology, U.S. News will carefully consider the impact of any such modification., 45992=Since the year 2000, LawTV has compiled the list of the best law schools in the United States, based on qualitative (rather than quantitative) criteria.  More than half a million pre-law students, law students, law professors, and lawyers use the Law School 100 rankings each year., 10880=Wednesday, July 27, 2011}
